job title: មន្ត្រីផ្នែកប្រឹក្សាឥណទាន - ១៦០ នាក់
position: មន្ត្រីផ្នែកប្រឹក្សាឥណទាន - ១៦០ នាក់
Job Description: គោលបំណងសំខាន់ៗនៃតួនាទីជា “មន្ត្រីផ្នែកប្រឹក្សាឥណទាន” គឺកំណត់អំពីភារកិច្ច និងការទទួលខុសត្រូវក្នុងការចុះផ្សព្វផ្សាយអំពីផលិតផល សេវាកម្មរបស់ ធនាគារ ហត្ថា និងរៀបចំឯកសារបញ្ចេញឥណទានជូនអតិថិជន រួចតាមដាននិងប្រមូលឥណទានដែលយឺតយ៉ាវក្នុងការសងត្រឡប់។Location: រាជធានីភ្នំពេញ - ៣៩នាក់ | ខេត្តបន្ទាយមានជ័យ - ០៣នាក់ | ខេត្តបាត់ដំបង - ០៦នាក់ | ខេត្ដកំពង់ចាម - ០៨នាក់ | ខេត្ដកំពង់ឆ្នាំង - ០៣នាក់ | ខេត្ដកោះកុង - ០៤នាក់ | ខេត្ដកំពង់ធំ - ១០នាក់ | ខេត្ដកំពត់ - ០៤នាក់ | ខេត្ដកណ្ដាល - ៣៣នាក់ | ខេត្ដក្រចេះ - ០៣នាក់ | ខេត្ដកំពង់ស្ពឺ - ០២នាក់ | ខេត្ដព្រះសីហនុ - ០៧នាក់ | ខេត្ដព្រៃវែង - ០៩នាក់ | ខេត្ដតាកែវ - ០៨នាក់ | ខេត្ដត្បូងឃ្មុំ - ០៤នាក់ | ខេត្ដពោធិ៍សាត់ - ០៦នាក់ | ខេត្ដសៀមរាប - ០៤នាក់ | ខេត្ដស្វាយរៀង - ០៥នាក់ | ខេត្ដព្រះវិហារ - ០២នាក់Duties and Responsibilities.ធ្វើការផ្សព្វផ្សាយអំពី ផលិតផល សេវាកម្ម របស់ ធនាគារ ហត្ថា ដើម្បីពង្រីកទីផ្សារ និងទាក់ទាញអតិថិជនសក្តានុពល។.ធ្វើការប្រឹក្សា និងពិគ្រោះយោបល់ ជាមួយអតិថិជន ដើម្បីជាដំណោះស្រាយផ្នែកហិរញ្ញវត្ថុជូនអតិថិជន។.រៀបចំឯកសារឥណទាន ប្រមូលព័ត៌មាន វាយតម្លៃឥណទានជូនអតិថិជន តាមដាននិងដោះស្រាយនៃការសងត្រលប់របស់អតិថិជន។.រៀបចំផែនការសកម្មភាពដើម្បីឲ្យសម្រេចតាមផែនការសូចនករទាំងប្រចាំខែ ប្រចាំឆ្នាំរបស់ខ្លួន។.អនុវត្តតាមលំហូរការងារឥណទាន និងតាមសេចក្តីសម្រេចដែលមានសុពលភាពឲ្យមានប្រសិទ្ធភាព។.បំពេញការងារផ្សេងៗតាមការចាត់តាំងរបស់ប្រធានផ្នែកប្រឹក្សាឥណទាន និងនាយកសាខា។
Job Requirement: .ជាប់បាក់ឌុប ឬកំពុងសិក្សាថ្នាក់បរិញ្ញាបត្ររង ឬបរិញ្ញាបត្រលើគ្រប់ជំនាញ។.មានបទពិសោធន៍ផ្នែកលក់ ឬការផ្សព្វផ្សាយកាន់តែល្អប្រសើរ។.មានអត្តចរិកល្អ មានភាពស្មោះត្រង់ ម៉ឹងម៉ាត់ សុភាពរាបសារ រួសរាយរាក់ទាក់និងមានឆន្ទៈក្នុងការធ្វើការងារ។.មានប្រវត្តិរស់នៅក្នុងសហគមន៍ល្អ ត្រូវមានម៉ូតូផ្ទាល់ខ្លួននិងអាចបើកបរបាន។.ផ្នែកគណិតវិទ្យាអាចវិភាគ គណនា និងយល់ដឹងពីផ្នែកទីផ្សារ។
Company Profile:
Hattha Bank is a leading bank in Cambodia, licensed by National Bank of Cambodia. Having been operating for more than 26 years with MDI status in the market, with its rapidly success, Hattha Bank has transformed its status from MDI to commercial bank in 2020, and continue providing diversified financial services to individual and SME businesses; and jump into retail consumer financial market and corporate customer in urbanities.

Hattha Bank is a subsidiary of Bank of Ayudhya (Krungsri), the fifth largest commercial bank in Thailand, and a member of MUFG Bank, the Japan’s largest banking group, and one of the largest and most diversified financial groups in the world.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   069 222 800 – 086 354 354 career@hatthabank.com Phnom Penh អគារលេខ៦០៦ ផ្លូវលេខ២៧១ សង្កាត់បឹងទំពុន១ ខណ្ឌមានជ័យ រាជធានីភ្នំពេញ 069 222 800 – 086 354 354

job title: Senior Unit Manager, Business Development for Public Corporation - 01 post.
position: Senior Unit Manager, Business Development for Public Corporation - 01 post.
Job Description: The main purpose of the “Senior Unit Manager, Business Development for Public Corporation” is responsible for building good relationship with governments to bring new business corporation opportunity for bank to support long term growth and comprehensive ecosystem.Location: Head Office, Phnom PenhDuties and Responsibilities.Build good networking with government and high net worth people to explore the business opportunity..Conduct market needs assessment for business development opportunity cover across areas of loan, liability products, fee-based income product, and enhance banking facilities..Prepare the business proposal to ensure both Hattha Bank and strategic partners get a fair benefit..Lead and manage with business partner for business agreement, business requirement development, process mapping, reconciliation process, end-to-end process to ensure the smoothness after business implementation..Lead and facilitate the preparation of Medium-Term Business Plan (MTBP) and yearly Operational Plan (OP) to support long term strategic direction..Deliver the strategic initiatives (SI) set by company..Facilitate the preparation of the marketing strategy, promotional campaign, marketing activities, message communication to market to ensure the mislead communication..Design and monitor the business performance and regular update to align with business partners..Building, improve staff capability by equip sale techniques, skills, understanding to deal with all types of customers..Perform other task as assigned by supervisor or management.
Job Requirement: .Master degree in banking/finance or business management, or related fields..At least 03 years’ experience in corporate banking, other financial or financial services industry..Have good connection with government officerPrior other financial product management experience is preferred..Extensive knowledge in other financial products, analytical, quantitative, problem solving, communication (written and verbal), presentation, relationship management skills..Be proficient in English both speaking and writing..Be innovative, dynamic, and confident.
Company Profile:
Hattha Bank is a leading bank in Cambodia, licensed by National Bank of Cambodia. Having been operating for more than 26 years with MDI status in the market, with its rapidly success, Hattha Bank has transformed its status from MDI to commercial bank in 2020, and continue providing diversified financial services to individual and SME businesses; and jump into retail consumer financial market and corporate customer in urbanities.

Hattha Bank is a subsidiary of Bank of Ayudhya (Krungsri), the fifth largest commercial bank in Thailand, and a member of MUFG Bank, the Japan’s largest banking group, and one of the largest and most diversified financial groups in the world.

Job Description: System Administration Unit is to administrate, maintain and support all the hardware infrastructure of Core Banking System, ATM & Mobile Banking System, and Hattha Bank internal application system. Manage and controlling the resources utilization of hardware in order to reduce the hardware and software operating expense. To implement and manage the Disaster Recovery and Data Continuity Plan to prevent from critical and high risk of hardware failure. The main task is to maintain the system up and running 24/7 with the minimum impact.Location: Head Office, Phnom PenhDuties and Responsibilities.Install and configure Operating System (Unix, Linux and Window Server)..Install and configure new virtual machines on Oracle VM for x86 and Oracle VM for SPARC..Perform daily performance and resources monitoring for operation system and Oracle servers..Monitor resources of servers, storages, troubleshoot, Operating System, virtualization (Oracle VM for Sparc and x86)..Implement securities of operating system and perform regular securities monitoring to identify any possible intrusions..Perform patching on the system (OS, Server, and Storage) as required..Utilize resources efficiency on Server and Storage for production, DR, and UAT environment..Implement and monitor user access rights on System..Implement the Disaster Recovery, Data Continuity Plan and new system administration procedure..Assist Manager on security enhancement on OS, Server, and Storage..Report to Manager of System Admin when there is any un-proper activity on the system..To ensure system is running 24/7 without interruption..Perform other tasks as assigned by supervisor.
Job Requirement: .Bachelor Degree of Computer Science or related fields..At least two-years experiences as System Administrator especially on Oracle Hardware..Working experience at MFI or Bank is a plus..Good knowledge of Oracle Solaris, Oracle Linux, Oracle VM for x86 and SPARC..Good knowledge of Oracle Server and Oracle Storage..Able to work at night for solving critical issue or other tasks assigned by management..Good at oral and written communication skills both English and Khmer..Willing to learn new business application and new technology.

1. Corporate Solution Product and Pricing support (50%)
- Generate quotation for Corporate Solution products
within the turnaround time.

assist with product and pricing related enquiries.

based on market and sales proposition.

requirements and other related documents before new product go live.

materials, product submission documents to MEF and marketing materials to ensure they are align with the product pricing model.

- UAT testing on IL/COAST system to make sure they are all align with the product pricing model.

- Support day2 feature such as requests for change
payment mode, change sum insured and premium after policy issue.
4. Other actuarial related support (10%)

- Calculate persistency for each sale channel for
monthly reporting and compensation schemes calculation.
- Handling other related customer service queries.
- Mentoring actuarial analyst and intern for the BAU
tasks and support required.

(Insurance or Actuarial related preferred) (Experience with
group product is preferred)

Job Description:
POSITION SUMMARY
- To build and maintain a strong efficient team.
- To create a loyal and trustworthy staff, who take pride in their work providing the highest quality of food possible
- To absolute cleanliness, wear company uniforms and name tag.
- To monitor the complete understanding of orders with other Commis.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
- To obey all instructions from team leader
- To have a complete understanding of information and to follow up on policies relating to fire, hygiene, health and safety.
- To respect the kitchen organization chart.
- Pick up food or material requisitions.
- To know about food knowledge skill
- To ensure that all the preparation and cooking procedures are followed according to established recipes.
- To maintain communication with sta

ADDITION DUTIES
- Any other job/tasks are required by own Department
- Work overtime for special events which will be compensated within one month.
- Required to comply with every reasonable request from their hierarchical supervisor(s) within an amount of time that it takes to comply under normal circumstances.
- May be assigned to other duties in the hotel as and when required based on business demand.

UNDERSTAND NEXT COFFEE & BAKERY CORE VALUES, MISSION & VISION
Trust:
Keep promises, be trustworthy to your colleagues, and equally, must trust your colleagues, at all times.
Positivity:
Maintain a positive outlook in all circumstances, and have fun in the process!
Respect:
Treat people as you expect to be treated by others; You must value your colleagues views and embrace diversity.
Honesty:
Act with honesty, integrity and sincerity in all your actions, at all times.
Team work:
Be open with each other, support each other, and put team success ahead of personal success, and treat each other as ‘family’.
Excellence:
Strive to be the best, and embrace this approach at all times.
Responsibility:
Assume full responsibility for the outcome of your decisions, be it success or failture.
Communication:
Listen to each other’s opinions and messages, and share them coherently with colleagues, subordinates and management, in the interest of the company.

CONFIDENTIALITY
Ensure Hotel or Restaurants, Customer and Staff information or transactions are kept confidential during or after employment with the company.

GENERAL DUTIES
- Wear Company uniform and name badge.
- Participate in training session.
- To assist and have a student attitude during the training programs.
- Carries out all reasonable duties as assigned by management.
- Behave at all time in a manner which projects the good image of the Company.
- To have a cleanliness appearance as well as good personal hygiene and clean uniforms.
- To have a positive working attitude.
- To show ones interest for the kitchen job.
- To listen the Executive Chef and Sous Chef recommendation.
- To complement and maintain quality standards as they relate to sanitation and cleanliness. as they relate to kitchen manual.
- To maintain all operating and fixed equipment.
- To know perfectly all food items and methods in which way they are prepared,vwhen dealing with direct guest contact.
- Establish good relation with guests.
Job Requirement:
REQUESTED QUALIFICATIONS & YEARS OF EXPERIENCE
- Minimum 2 - 3 years’ experience as related job
- High School of education or other qualification course.

ADDITIONAL ATTRIBUTES, SKILLS & ABILITIES
- Interpersonal and communication skill
- Friendly, responsible, and honesty
- Able to work flexible hour to meet the needs of the business
- Need Khmer & English writing and oral skills if Possible
- To have a positive working attitude.
- Behave at a time in a manner which projects the good image of the company.

Job Description: OpportunityResponsible for all vessel operations, ground operations.Key Responsibilities:Marine & Ground operations- In general, act as focal point to coordinate between various parties (ship, area office, customer service, sales, global service center, partners, terminal, suppliers etc) to ensure a smooth call of Sealand vessel to Cambodia port, and smooth daily ground operations.- Work with relevant parties to create optimal Berthing Plan for ships calling to Cambodia port in the way that ensure vessel can berth as early as possible, shorten port stay and depart as early as possible.- Work with terminal and relevant parties to deliver high berth/work productivity during port stay and monitor the load/discharge process.- Adjust Stowage plan for loading with Chief officer and terminal to ensure a high load/discharge productivity and high schedule reliability, safety.- Arrange and coordinate all vessel husbandry matters to ensure vessel smoothly arrive and depart.- Coordinate with relevant parties for all vessel/container incidents happening at local (twistlock, reefer damage, cargo transfer, vessel damage and etc)- Ensure port memo system correctly updated for Cambodia port.- Ensure all vessel reports are sent by relevant parties in timely manner (TDR, final load list, departure baplie, container damage report, seal mismatch and etc).- Coordinate with all relevant parties to set up new terminal, service call.- Arrange for loading late gate in container, outlist container as per agreement with related parties.- Work with terminal to get favorable proforma window as per request from Sealand HQ.- Work with local authority including Port Authority, Pilot, Police, Custom following instruction from manager.- Coordinate with Finance Business partner and other relevant parties to monitor and protect cost. In daily work, propose the operations solution that is cost optimal for the business.- Coordinate matters related to transportation plan such as cut off time, out of gauge (OOG) acceptance, dangerous goods (DG) acceptance.- Keep track of performance via KPI, take proper action to drive for improvement.- Proactively work with commercial team, Local Product and render support to deliver a good service to customer.- Support L&S volume/GP growth, support internal Intermodal/CHB business.- Continuously find way to improve process, SOP.- Coordinate with relevant parties to resolve any ad-hoc situation.
Job Requirement: - Bachelor’s degree level education in Business or other relevant discipline with 1-3 years’ work experience after graduation, in parallel with education or between degrees. Fresh Graduate is welcomed to apply.- An excellent command of spoken and written English.- Fast learner, team player, flexible in terms of working hours and work allocation assigned by management.- Willingness to work 24/7 in case required.

Job Description:
- Provide expert Operational Management support for virtual infrastructure and automation tools: VMware vSphere 7.x (VSAN and NSX-T), VMware SRM, VMWare vRealize Orchestration and Automation, Ansible Tower, and Azure DevOps, Oracle WebSphere, etc.
- Configure & managing real-time/continuous health monitoring on supported technologies.
- Resolve incidents and problems related to supported technologies and integrations within SLA specifications.
- Execute configuration management changes on supported technologies, as necessary.
- Execute standardized request fulfillment within SLA specifications while identifying opportunities to promote
task automation by recommending design and implementing features.
- Ensure proper testing and maintain documentation or release notes.
- Perform technology upgrades & maintain to ensure compliance with vendor-provided compatibility matrices,
and to maintaining required cybersecurity controls.
- Perform capacity management on IT infrastructure and respond to audit requests.
- Perform supported technology functional testing and health checks during change, incident management and other activities as required.
- Assist in ISO 27001:2013 compliance requirements and related audits
- Assist for hardware & software related matters for reporting to local vendors or Group IT support if required.
- Follow up any hardware & software licenses related to infrastructure/tools.
- Assist the IT team on improving security related audit findings (if any) and coordinate closely work with
auditors (Internal, External, and International).
- Ensuring all IT Infrastructure, Hardware & Software is ready for daily operations of Head Office and Branch - Manage Multi Cloud Infrastructure including Web Access Firewalls, Proxy, SSL etc.
- Assist on Vulnerability Assessments & Penetration Testing as per regulator and Group Security policies and
procedures.
- You are also responsible for managing, mentoring and upgrading the skills of the System Administration team
members who will be reporting to you.
- Any other duties within your competencies or skills entrusted by the management
Job Requirement:
- University Degree in Computer Science or a related subject
- At least 2-3 years of experience working with VMware vSphere 7.x (VSAN and NSX-T), VMware SRM, VMWare vRealize Orchestration and Automation, Ansible Tower, Azure DevOps, Oracle WebSphere.
- Hands-on experience with systems in Windows and Linux/Unix
- Reasonable understanding in scripting languages such as Powershell, Cloudshell
- Work experience in creating automation scripts, and developing orchestration and automation processes and
products will be added advantages
- Understanding of Email Security Technologies and implementation. (Ex: SPF, DKIM, DMARC, Hygiene)
- Experience in managing storage systems such as NAS, SAN, Hyper Converged, Cloud Object Storage etc.
- Hands-on experience with the NBC systems or Financial Sector Infrastructure will be an added advantage
- knowledge on Cloud platform such as GCP, AWS, Oracle or Azure will be an added advantage
- Knowledge of Office 365 Administration
- VMWare Certified Professional is preferable
- One or more cloud technologies certification and/or Linux/Unix certification is preferable
- Strong communication skill (Reading, Writing & Speaking on English is preferable).
- Willingness to travel to province or overseas when required.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
- Monitor and keep track of project progress and are responsible for the measurement and valuation of variations in the work during the contract, for agreement of interim payments and the final account.

- Carry out monthly valuations of work in progress, including forecasting of final costs and sales
- Procure or agree the services of subcontractors who work on the construction of the project 
- Control subcontractor work progress and subcontractor payment claim 
- Measure and value the work progress and completion on site
- Report monthly on project financial report
- Arrange to submit (Material, Drawing and installation)
- Comparison between MR with LPO&PO
- Checked and Collected all delivery slip 
- Summary all delivery by Projects
- Check Inventory by projects

Job Description:
* Process Invoices:

- Perform the bill run process on SAP. You will need to have an understanding of some applications such as SAP, Salesforces, and SQL.
Issue the invoice to the customer/vendor timely.

* Report and Resolve Payment Issues 

- This is a task that can require conflict resolution skills, as it can involve disputing payment and reconciling issues with both internal stakeholders as well as external vendors. 
Coordinate with other departments and external vendors to solve the payment or invoicing issue.
Process the adjustment timely and accurately.

* Support Month End Close Reporting 

- You should understand the Revenue Accounting Principles and own the corresponding entries in the financial statements. 
- Prepare reports and assist in any data entry when required.
- Evaluate, plan, and implement improvements in all business processes and practices surrounding foodpanda’s delivery rider payroll and vendor payment cycles.
- Support the finance payment operations teams in the countries to complete all “procure to pay” (P2P) accounting and reconciliation activities.
- Work closely with the global process owners and ensure all accounting activities of P2P processes are executed effectively and efficiently with appropriate controls and end to end view.
- Work closely with the payables and systems support team to continually automate, streamline, and improve current reporting, operational and reconciliation processes to improve business efficiency in the region.
- Serve as the subject matter expert pertaining to finance operations relating to P2P processes in the region.

Job Description:
About the job
This role is responsible for managing the front to end HR and payroll operations for APLL's. It is a business-facing role and heavily execution oriented. This role will foster partnership across the region to deliver value-added service to management and employees that reflect the business objectives of APLL.

** Roles & Responsibilities
This position is responsible for but not limited to the following:
Talent Acquisition
- Work with business leaders proactively to understand current / future manpower needs.
- Develop sustainable talent acquisition and hiring plans and strategies.
- Evaluate and identify the best candidate sourcing platforms for the organization.
- Provide continuous improvement in the talent acquisition process.
- Participate and provide feedback in the recruitment and selection process of designated positions.
- Provide timely update on the recruitment status of positions in hiring.
- Plan, design and execute employer branding activities.

On-Boarding
- Ensure all on-boarding activities are conducted according to On-Boarding Guideline.
- Conduct New Hire Orientation to new hire employees.
- Act as main focal point for new hire employees.
- Conduct follow-up meetings with new hire employees on their on-boarding experience, and managers on how the new hire employees settled in APLL environment.
- Evaluate and provide continuous improvement in on-boarding process.

Compensation &  Benefits
- Verify and process monthly payroll.
- Conduct service level review meetings with service providers.
- Manage the annual performance review exercise.
- Partner with Global Rewards in annual market benchmark salary and benefits study.
- Evaluate and advice on employee promotion and salary adjustment requests.

Talent Management
- Act as business partner and provide HR advice to business leaders, line managers and employees.
- Act a HR change agent and drive HR transformation agenda by developing transition / change plans and communication strategy.
- Plan, design and execute employee engagement activities.
- Conduct regular meetings with business leaders and managers on people issues, and develop action plans to support the business from people perspective.
- Act as primary investigator in cases related to people’s performance, ethics, people relations etc.
- Execute talent and performance management programs and processes designed to develop and retain talent for the organization.
- Execute policies and procedures with alignment to corporate goals and objectives and acting in accordance with legal regulations & obligations.
- Stay within framework of organization's overall corporate governance, policies, plans and programs.
 Coach and provide support, resources, and guidance to HR team during talent management processes, to ensure smooth implementation of daily HR operations

Talent Development
- Partner with Global Learning & Organizational Development team in conducting local training needs analysis.
- Provide inputs in the training program design and post-training evaluation.
- Conduct talent reviews and succession planning exercise and meetings with managers to identify key talents for further career development in APL Logistics.
- Provide advice to people managers on developing his/her direct reports’ career. 

Others
- Conduct regular HR internal audit to ensure all HR tasks are complied with internal policies and local regulations.
- Prepare annual headcount and G&A budget and monitor the monthly spending to ensure no overspending.
- Handle Administration duties which include office lease/renovation, security, and other facilities matters.
- Organize employee engagement events, townhalls for senior management visits and other company events.
Job Requirement:
Qualification
- Degree or equivalent; preferably in Human Resources Management, Business Administration, or related field

Requirements
- Minimum 5 years’ relevant experience in Human Resources leadership role preferably in international organizations, either in Logistics or Financial Shared Services industry.
- Proven track record in rolling out HR initiatives and thrives in a fast paced, results driven environment.
- Well-versed in local labor ordinance and other HR related regulations (e.g. pension, retirement, occupational health and safety etc.).
- Strong management skills with ability to handle multiple key stakeholders.
- Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
- Strong operational excellence, innovation and continuous improvement mind-set.
- Strong analytic and execution skills with attention to details.
- Must have a good sense of urgency in meeting deadlines with a positive “can-do” attitude.
- Meticulous and a strong team player.
- Good in English and local language (written and spoken).
- Good PC skills (MS Office), experience in Tableau will be an advantage 

** Please email your CV, current and expected salaries to Jeffrey_Liew@APLLogistics.com. Only shortlisted
candidates will be notified.

Job Description:
Job Purpose
The primary objective of this position is to carry out HR Operations for the whole country and ensure in compliance with local regulations, laws and corporate policies and guidelines. The person will be responsible for managing payroll data and pay on time, ensure all personnel data
are updated and proper filing with high confidentiality and secured, provide update and accurate information to employees. He/she also support HRBP in any assigned tasks such as training and development, employee engagement etc.

Roles & Responsibilities
- Prepare payroll data updates and ensure it is paid on time (calculate OT, update new employees, resigned employees)
- Create POs for all HR & Admin expenses and prepare payment to government offices
- Update employee’s data and other required information
- Remind and follow up employees to complete annual Code of Conduct acknowledgement, Security E-learning, Performance Management (Goal Setting, Check-In, and Year End Review)
- Update information to employees regard any changes of labour requirement and other related issue
- Support HRPB in recruitment and selection from the start to the end cycle and onboarding
- Ensure in compliance with corporate policy and local law and regulations
- Assist HR team to execute training plan and employee engagement activities
- Ensure employees engagement activities are carried out
- Support regional and corporate team to executive any employees experience survey
- Performed all related administrative tasks and procurement for Cambodia office
- Other tasks assigned by direct superiors
Job Requirement: Qualification- Bachelor of Human Resources Management or related fieldRequirements- Experience in human resources management function and administrative work is a plus- Good at English (both writing and speaking).- Knowledge in MS. Office (Excel, Word, Power Point)- Data orientated and paid attention to details- Organize and documented person- Self-motivated and results driven- Be able to propose solution in data management- Open minded and be able to diversifyKey Result Areas- Accomplished the set KPI and assigned tasks- Payroll are paid on time- Employees receive accurate information- Employees files are managed in good manners and high confidential** Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for interview.

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information RMA CAMBODIA  017888390 recruitment.kh@rmagroup.net #27, St. 134, SangkatMittapheap, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 017888390

Job Description:
•	Check and manage daily produced vehicle in inspection process by visiting assembly plant to confirm whether inspection and quality condition is okay or not
•	Investigate root cause of any vehicle defect with team leader and team members and put in place measures that will prevent recurrent defects that will affect daily production plan
•	Prepare daily report on quality condition and production problem based on feedback from the team leader to the Factory Manager
•	Organize daily meetings in the morning to update team leaders and team members on vehicle defect and production problem from previous report and provide measures or find ways to improve upon the defects encountered
•	Discuss with the Factory manager, and decide on the best way to solve defective parts (either by repairing or changing ) in order not to affect production plan
•	Approve technical document received from Toyota Motor Corporation and modify the inspection manual if necessary
•	To update team leaders and team members on any modification and ensure it is applied appropriately
•	Any other related duties assigned by the top management.

Working Day/Hour
•	Working Day : Monday to Saturday (6days/week)
•	Working Hour : 8:00am to 5:00pm (8hours/day, 1hour lunch break)
Allowance & Benefits
•	Bonus: 1 month salary/year
•	Transport Allowance: To be confirmed
•	Food Allowance: To be confirmed
•	House Allowance: To be confirmed
•	Attendance Allowance: To be confirmed
•	OT pay: Yes (Refer to labor law)
•	Annual Leave: 1.5 days per a month of services(Refer to labor law)
•	NSSF: To be confirmed
•	Seniority Bonus: Refer to labor law
Job Requirement:
•	Must have a valid driver license
•	Must have a valid passport or able to get one for overseas travel
•	Bachelor or above in the faculty of mechanical engineering
•	Language Competency in English
•	Computer Literacy – able to use excel to prepare reports; power point presentation etc.
•	At least 4 years experiences in related field.
Desired Qualification
•	Language Competency in Japanese

Job Description:
Electrical technicians help create, maintain, and repair the electronic components and equipment used in any equipment or device that involves electricity, and it sometimes work with electricians or electrical engineers, or work on site to keep machinery and specialty equipment running correctly.

What will you do:
• Install, maintain, and repair electrical power, lighting, and control systems.
• Inspect electrical components, such as transformers and circuit breakers
• Identify electrical problems using a variety of testing devices
• Repair or replace wiring, equipment, or fixtures using hand tools and power tools
• Test electrical systems and continuity of circuits in electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures, using testing devices such as ohmmeters, voltmeters, and oscilloscopes, to ensure compatibility and safety of the system.
• Advise management on whether continued operation of equipment could be hazardous
• Direct and train workers to install, maintain, or repair electrical wiring or equipment
• Comply with safety regulations and maintain clean and orderly work areas.
• Perform other duties as assigned
Job Requirement:
What you should have:

• Associate degree in electrical or electronic engineering technology from a vocational school, or Technical School.
• At least 1 year of experience as a general technician
• Outstanding acquaintance with safety, health, and environmental regulations.
• Basic understanding of electrical, hydraulic, and other systems
• Knowledge of general maintenance processes and methods
• Good time management and punctuality
• Well-motivated with a can-do attitude

Job Description:
Duties and Responsibilities

• Communicate regularly with the related departments to get a clear view of its hiring needs, and anticipate future employment needs
• Plan and implement company talent acquisition strategy aligns with organizational goals
• Work with the related hiring manager to create, and update all employee job descriptions to attract qualified candidates
• Conduct sourcing activities to fill open positions such as preparing job announcements for online job postings and social media etc.
• Serve as a brand ambassador at various events, like NEA Career Fairs, Chip Mong Career Day, Student Visit Program, or on-campus recruiting events (walk-in interview, etc.)
• Represent the company externally at events with a goal of networking and relationship building with potential candidate communities such as colleges, and universities to aid in recruiting.
• Design and manage recruitment and selection processes (resume screening, screening calls, talent assessment, and interviews, etc.)
• Reviews employment applications and background check
• Identify the top candidate, and create a job offer to the successful candidate
• Partner with the HR team to deliver on-boarding of new employees
• Administer, verify and follow up on any relevant hiring documents for new employees
• Counsel the candidate on corporate benefits, salary, and corporate environment
• Build long-term relationships with past and potential candidates
• Manage respective candidate pools to ensure qualified candidates remain engaged in current or future opportunities
• Keep recruitment master list record up to date to generate weekly, and monthly reports
• Suggest new ideas for improving talent acquisition activities
• Perform other duties as assigned

Profile and Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, Education, or a related field
• At least 1 year of experience in human resources, preferably in recruitment
• Knowledge of human resource management
• Good business acumen
• Intermediate to advanced English proficiency
• Familiarity with various recruitment websites
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills
• Intermediate to advanced proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook).
• Strong negotiation and presentation skills
• Ability to work well individually and as a team
• Ability to work under pressure
• Live the company’s Vision, Mission, and Core values.

Job Description:
Job Summary
Assist the Talent & Organization Development (TOD) department in the design, development, implementation, and evaluation of TOD initiatives/programs/processes that support organizational goals and business strategy.

Job Description:
•	Assist the TOD department in the design, development, implementation, and evaluation of Organization Development (OD) initiatives/programs/processes that support organizational objectives and that are aligned with the organization’s business strategy. Main projects include performance management system design and development, talent management, change management, and employee engagement surveys and initiatives
•	Performance Management: assist the TOD department in the management of the overall performance management system including goal-setting, quarterly reviews, mid-year reviews, performance appraisal, performance calibration, increments, and bonuses
•	Talent Management: facilitate talent management programs including talent review, individual development program, succession planning and strategic workforce planning.
•	Employee Engagement: conduct employee engagement surveys and interviews; perform data clean-up, data analyses, and report write-ups; and identify initiatives required to enhance employee engagement and job performance
•	Organizational Design: assist line functions and relevant stakeholders in reviewing organizational charts and organizational restructuring
•	Change Management: provide support to line functions on large-scaled change management initiatives
•	Assist in reviewing and adapting the on-going OD strategy to meet current organizational needs and/or to respond to change requirements
•	Prepare and ensure the accuracy and timeliness of reports and presentations delivered by the OD department to executive leaders, senior managers, and other relevant stakeholders
•	Provide the required administrative support on various on-going OD projects
•	Perform other duties as assigned
Job Requirement:
Job Requirements:
•	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Psychology, Business, Education, or related field. Master’s degree is preferred
•	At least 2 years of experience in OD or training & development or related field
•	Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office
•	Knowledge of statistical software packages (e.g. SPSS, R) is a plus
•	Knowledge of SAP Organizational Management Module is a plus
•	Knowledge of SAP SuccessFactors is a plus
•	Familiarity with qualitative and/or quantitative research
•	Strong planning, organizational, and presentation skills
•	Strong communication skills in Khmer and English
•	Strong attention to detail
•	Strong analytical skills
•	High Emotional Intelligence
•	Ability to think creatively and innovatively
•	Ability to prioritize and manage change
•	Ability to work under pressure

Job Description:
- Collaborating on debt collection efforts with Accounts, Sales, and the Legal Department.
- Developing debt collection strategies and plans.
- Examining and creating draft agreements (SPA) pertaining to organization's projects;
- Follow up and coordinate payment with customers 
- Keep record all unit signed for both party (Company & Customer)
- Assist in all aspects of the account receivable function including invoicing, payment processing, and managing accounts and all collections
- Prepare commission or agency, broker and buyer and submit it to finance department 
- Keep all record of payment collected and outstanding 
- Prepare and deliver notice and reminder letter to customer to inform their payment
Prepare daily summary report
- Other tasks as assigned by manager/finance manager.
Job Requirement:
- Minimum 2-3 years’ experience 
- Qualification BA in Accounting, Finance and Banking 
- Work closely with legal department, sales and marketing department, especially finance 
- Honesty and working hard 
- Good attitude and friendly 
- English speaking and writing, priority if can speak Chinese.
Company Profile:
Hong Lai Huat Group Limited (HLH Group) is a well-established and reputable real estate and property developer with 30 years of successful track record. Established since 1998, the Group has completed numerous projects in Singapore ranging from public and private resident developments, to commercial and industrial building. Some of its notable developments include D’Ecosia, D’s Fresco, D’s Castilia, D’Almira, D’ Lithium, D’Kranji Farm Resort and D’Centenial.

In 2008, the Group diversified into the agriculture sector in Cambodia and had since completed the development of a 10,000 hectares farmland that cultivates cassava, as well as invested in a cassava starch production factory.

The Group also expanded into property development in Cambodia with the development of its first freehold mixed-used project- D’ Seaview, in Sihanouk Ville. One of the largest mixed-use developments in Sihanouk Ville, D’Seaview comprises 737 residential units and 64 commercial units. HLH Group was listed on the Mainboard of the Singapore Exchange on 21st June 2000.

1- HLH Agriculture (Cambodia) Co., Ltd.
2- HLHI (Cambodia) Co., Ltd.
3- Royal Hong Lai Haut One Company Limited.
4- Jewel A Development Co., Ltd.
5- Agri-Oral Joint Cooperate Co., Ltd.
6- Public Housing Development (Cambodia) Co., Ltd.
7- PH One Development (Cambodia) Co., Ltd.

Company Profile: Since its founding in 1982, Chip Mong has focused extensively on the changing needs of the society and the strengthening of its relationships with business communities, both domestically and internationally. Job Description: To process and analyze micro business loan application by conducting credit investigations, scoring, credit checking and other underwriting activities to ensure good lending and loan quality of the branch.Location•	Phnom Penh and Provincial Branches (100 Posts)Duties and Responsibilities•	Solicit both potentially existing and new clients in accordance with the guidelines stated in the micro business loan policies and procedures to ensure the secured loans.•	On-board new micro business loans to ensure delivery of disbursement target.•	Explain to clients the different types of loans and credit options that are available, as well as the terms of those services for further cross-selling.•	Collect all clients’ required documents for loan application to ensure their eligibility for having it approved.•	Conduct credit investigation to analyze applicants’ financial status, credit, property evaluations, repayment capacity to determine feasibility of granting loans.•	Gather valid applicants’ financial records by obtaining and compiling copies of clients’ credit histories, corporate financial statement and other financial information to prevent them from being conned.•	Conduct a site visit during loan assessment process to obtain in-depth information concerning to the purpose of customer’s loan application and ensure customer security for the loan is sufficient and acceptable.•	Make the regular site visits to existing customers in order to determine whether the loan should stay the same or be downgraded due to the actual condition of their loan collateral and/or financial situation as well as to develop relationship with customers for further cross-selling.•	Follow up delinquent client immediately and refer such case to the supervisor in order to proactively handle the branch loan portfolio.•	Process registration of title deeds at local authority and land office to acquire the legal evidence of client’s right to ownership of the property.•	Stay abreast of new types of loans and other financial services and products to better meet customer needs.
Job Requirement: •	High School Diploma or bachelor’s degree in finance and banking, accounting or any relevant field.•	Minimum one year of working experiences in banking and financial services industry with a strong track record in granting loans.•	Basic knowledge of the bank branch operations, rules and regulations, laws, granting loans, and credit risk management.•	Ability to use and communicate in both Khmer and English.•	Ability to use Microsoft Office and Bank’s software.•	Good sales and customer services skills.•	Good math skills and ability to spot numerical errors.•	Good problem solving, negotiation and interpersonal skill.•	Strong dedication to accuracy and efficiency.How to applyInterested and qualified applicants should submit your updated Cover Letter and CV stating the position applied for with your current photo (4x6) through recruitment@ababank.com
Company Profile: ABA Bank is Cambodia's leading private financial institution (not state-owned enterprise) founded in 1996 as the Advanced Bank of Asia Limited.In over 25 years of development and growth, ABA has significantly strengthened its position in the market and broke into the Top 3 commercial banks of the country. Today, ABA offers the entire spectrum of services to customer segments covering SMEs, micro businesses, and individuals.With 81 branches, 450+ ATMs, 480+ self-banking machines across the country, and advanced online banking and mobile banking platforms ABA Bank reaches out to a large number of customers with an array of modern financial services.

Job Description: To provide highly professional customer experiences by delivery of excellent customer services, tailored product and service consultations through inbound and outbound calls and messages to ensure quality inquiries/complaints escalation and achieve sales referrals of the Bank.Location•	Head Office, Phnom Penh (50 Posts)Duties and Responsibilities•	Respond customer’s calls and messages (through social media channels, emails and the Bank’s website) by following given standard script and customer service standard of ABA Bank.•	Ensure service level or service turnaround time of messages (social media channels, emails and Bank’s website) is achieved.•	Handle and resolve customer issues/complaints and/or identify and escalate priority issues/complaints to the right key person in-charge.•	Conduct complaint registration into system in timely and accurate manner.•	Provide customers with product and service consultations, specifications, terms and conditions with prepared sales script in order to achieve sales referral target.•	Act as a focal point to refer banking products to related teams for further cross-selling and achieve sales target.•	Complete call logs and prepare call reports on the timely manner.•	Contact businesses or private individuals by phone to survey about the service provided by ABA Bank.•	Keep up to date with ABA’s products suite and marketing campaigns to ensure superior product knowledge.•	Handle tasks assigned by Line Manager.
Job Requirement: •	Bachelor’s degree in Professional Communication, Finance and Banking, Accounting or any relevant field.•	Less than one year of working experiences in relevant field.•	Ability to use and communicate via social medias with professional writing style.•	Good listening, sales, customer services, communication, negotiation, problem solving, teamwork and interpersonal skills.•	Excellent product knowledge of financial services.•	Practical knowledge of banking operations, rules and regulations, and operational risks.•	Good flexibility, critical thinking and relationship management skills.•	Ability to use and communicate in both Khmer and English (Chinese is a plus).•	Microsoft Office and Bank’s software.•	Strong dedication to accuracy and efficiency.How to applyInterested and qualified applicants should submit your updated Cover Letter and CV stating the position applied for with your current photo (4x6) through recruitment@ababank.com
